snippet: The core inflation rate, which excludes food and energy prices,showed signs of firming up, which might encourage the Fed to raise interest rates this year.
abstract: Labor Department says Consumer Price Index fell 0.2 percent in September after slipping 0.1 percent in August; reports that core CPI, which omits food and energy costs, increased 1.9 percent, largest gain since July 2014, after advancing 1.8 percent in August.
lead_paragraph: The core inflation rate, which excludes food and energy prices,showed signs of firming up, which might encourage the Fed to raise interest rates this year.

headline.main: Cost of Gas Pushes Consumer Prices Lower, but Inflation May Be Picking Up
headline.print_headline: Cost of Gas Pushes Consumer Prices Lower, but Inflation May Be Picking Up
